page.title: 20Recreation in Ringland
page.content: 'I live in Taverham but usually we play in Ringland.In summer we{fish}and swim & in winter we{sledge}on Ringland Hills but its very dangerous. It joins a rd. and sometimes we can't stop and go into the rd. The{fishing rights}from the bridge at Attlebridge to Taverham bridge are shared by 3 landowners. The river has mostly{chubb & minnows.The}bait we use is{bread & maggots.}There are a few {eels}under Taverham bridge and lots of eels in Ringland so we're not allowed to swim there but there are{common {rights}at Ringland Bridge so we can swim ans fish there.'{(David Bye) { }The 20 pages of block 06120312 were written by the 4th yr. children (aged 12) of{St. Edmund's C of E. V.C. {Middle School}and their teachers but especially{Mrs.Judy Sims}and{Mr.James {Mansley}in June 1985.
